      • resetSolveSpan

        public void resetSolveSpan()
        Set both solve spans to 0.

      • solve

        public boolean solve()
        Solve uses the current ode and solving parameters to generate a solution. Points come to interested components (such as the graphs) via the point- and solutionReadyListener interfaces. The solve runs in its own thread in the backend, needing no further input from us.

      • solveForward

        public void solveForward()
        Solve forward for a curve.

      • solveBackward

        public void solveBackward()
        Solve backward for a curve.

      • solveOrbit

        public void solveOrbit()
        Solve for an orbit, which is one curve forward, one backward.

      • stopSolve

        public void stopSolve()
        If a current solver thread is running, cancelSolve kills it, ending the solve. This may cause problems in underlying data structures, but eventually we should not have this problem.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reload the ODEWorkspace, so reset some values

      • solutionReady

        public void solutionReady(double[][] sol)
        Respond when solving is done - probably solve backward if we are in orbit mode, or simply enable buttons on input panel.
        Specified by:
        solutionReady in interface SolutionReadyListener
